Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204 - 6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
2

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is obsessed with keys. In June of 2023 youth stole a golf
cart and attempted to escape. Youth has pending juvenile charges
for this incident. On 8/28/23, a staff member left an office unlocked
at which time youth was able to obtain a set of keys, leave the
facility, and steal an Eagle Village van. Youth drove the van off
campus and got it stuck in a ditch. Youth has no reported injuries.
Investigation Emails were exchanged with Complainant on August 31,
2023, and no further information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on August 31, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 2 who was face to face with
Youth A at Youth A’s new placement. Youth A refused to
answer any questions, his only response was, “I don’t want to
talk.” Youth A walked out of the interview.
Youth A was interviewed again by DHHS Worker 2 on
September 6, 2023. DHHS Worker 2 forgot to contact this worker
to join via telephone for the interview. DHHS Worker 2’s case
notes of the interview are: “Youth A stated that when he was
lodged at Eagle Village, he stole a van. Youth A stated that he
took the van because he wanted to go see his brother. Youth A
stated that the van is always parked in the same spot right outside
the house. Youth A stated that he got the keys to the van out of
the desk in the staff office. Youth A stated that the office is on the
second floor where the bedrooms are. Youth A stated that the
office door is never locked, and neither is the desk drawer. Youth
A stated that he knows the door and desk are not locked because
that is where they keep his video game. Youth A stated that there
is only one staff working the night shift and they were downstairs
doing laundry. Youth A stated that there was another time while at
Eagle Village that he hotwired and stole a golf cart. Youth A stated
that he does take medication and that all of the meds are locked
up at Eagle Village. Youth A stated that he did not have anything
else he wanted to talk about regarding his stay at Eagle Village.”
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on September 11,
2023. Youth A reported Staff 1 was downstairs when Youth A
3

went into the office and took the van keys. Youth A described the
staff office door being wide open, so he walked in the staff office
and went to the desk to look for the van keys. Youth A reported
the desk drawers were not locked and he was able to locate the
van keys. Youth A stated after he got the keys, he walked out of
the house. Youth A denied seeing Staff 1 after finding the keys or
prior to leaving the house.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
31, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Director stated
she was aware of the event; Youth A had no injuries, and the van
was found past Gerber House in the ditch. Director reported she
had not watched the video, but a staff member told her Staff 1
closed the door, but the door did not latch allowing Youth A to get
into the staff office and take the van keys.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 8, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1 and
via telephone September 19, 2023. Staff 1 reported Youth A
woke up approximately 2:30am and wanted to check on his
Nintendo Switch that was charging in the staff office. Staff 1
stated he brought Youth A into the staff office to check the
Nintendo Switch and noticed Youth A had an accident, so Staff 1
told Youth A to shower while he changed Youth A’s bedding. Staff
1 reported he walked out of the office with Youth A, Youth A got
into the shower and Staff 1 got clean clothes for Youth A. Staff 1
stated he went to Youth A’s bedroom to change the sheets and
walked back to the staff office to get cleaning supplies when he
found Youth A in the staff office. Staff 1 stated he asked Youth A
what he was doing in the staff office and Youth A responded with
“I was looking for you.” Staff 1 reported walking back out of the
office with Youth A and Youth A going to bed and Staff 1 went to
the basement to do laundry. Staff 1 stated he believed he closed
the staff office door when he went to the basement to do laundry.
Staff 1 described coming back upstairs from loading the laundry,
going to check on Youth A and not finding Youth A in his bedroom
or in the house. Staff 1 stated he could not recall if the staff office
door was open or closed when he entered the office with Youth A
to look at the Nintendo Switch or if he closed the door after looking
at the Nintendo Switch with Youth A. Staff 1 reported he was with
Youth A the entire time they were in the office looking at the
Nintendo Switch and did not see Youth A take anything. Staff 1
reported he closed the door on his way out of the staff office when
he was going to the basement to do laundry. Staff 1 stated he
believed he must not have fully shut the door, so it did not lock
when he went downstairs to do laundry. Staff 1 stated the staff
4

office door is supposed to be closed at all times, but he accidently
left the staff office door open. Staff 1 reported he did not know
where the van keys were kept, he assumed they were secured in
the medication room. Staff 1 denied seeing the van keys in the
desk drawer.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 8, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1.
Staff 2 described arriving to work a little before 7am to see Youth
A running from the van at Gerber House and up to the door at
Geber House. Staff 2 stated he approached Youth A and asked
him what he was doing at Gerber House, Youth A resides at a
different house on campus. Staff 2 reported Youth A told him he
had van keys, and he crashed a van down the road. Staff 2 stated
he drove Youth A to where Youth A reported he crashed the van
and saw the van in the ditch. Staff 2 radioed he had Youth A with
him and was bringing Youth A back to Putnam House. Staff 2
reported Youth A still had the keys to the van he crashed and was
able to convince Youth A to give him the keys. Staff 2 stated
Youth A would not tell him how he got the van keys only that he
was going to go see his cousin.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 6, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1.
Youth B stated he heard from someone Youth A drove a van and
crashed it. Youth B reported he did not know how Youth A got the
van keys. Youth B stated the van keys are kept in the staff office
and reported the staff office door is not always closed. Youth B
described the staff office door being left open for long periods of
time during the day or when staff are outside with all the youth.
Youth B stated he has never seen the staff office door open at
night. Youth B denied knowing specific staff members that leave
the staff office door open. Youth B stated youth are not allowed in
the staff office by themselves. Youth B denied seeing any youth
in the staff office by themselves. Youth B reported the only time a
youth is allowed in the staff office is if a staff is with the youth.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on September 6,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Therapist denied
having any concerns with the facility meeting Youth A’s needs.
Therapist reported Youth A would say he wanted “to get out of
here” but never talked about stealing a van.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of August 28, 2023, was reviewed on August
31, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Video was
5

started at approximately 1:58am and showed the staff office door
being open. Staff 1 is seen going in and out of the office with the
office door open the entire time. Youth A and Staff 1 are seen
talking outside the office then enter the office through the open
door. At 2:22am Youth A enters the office through the open door
and walks to the desk. Youth A opens the top desk drawer, picks
up the van keys, places them in his waistband and walks toward
the open office door. Staff 1 enters the office approximately 22
seconds after Youth A enters the office, is seen talking to Youth A
and then both leave the office with the door remaining open. Video
shows the staff office door being open prior to Youth A waking up
and remaining open even after Staff 1 finds Youth A in the office
and the two of them walking out of the office. Staff 1 does not
close the door until it appears he gathers laundry detergent. At
this time Youth A already has the keys in his possession.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record.
• Eagle Village Incident Report dated August 28, 2023, which
was consistent with Staff 1’s interview but not consistent
with video footage. Staff 1 wrote in the incident report,
“Once I had acquired Youth A's new clothes and a towel, I
went back in the office to get some cleaning supplies and
new bed sheets. After I got the new sheets, I went to close
the door not knowing the door never fully closed. I went
back to Youth A's room to clean. Youth A was still in the
shower. As I finished cleaning his bed and making it, I went
to check Youth A in the shower where I had left him. I
walked back down the hall to see he wasn't in the shower.
Then I walk backed to the office and noticed I must not
have fully closed the door as it was unlocked with Youth A
in it. I found Youth A in the office and asked what he was
doing.” The video does not show Staff 1 closing the door
after getting new sheets.
• Eagle Village 7.2 Signing out of Vehicles and Other Eagle
Village Equipment Policy: Policy states, “Return the
keys/paperwork during business hours to Holbrook. Return
the keys/paperwork after business hours to the exterior
drop box at Holbrook, located next to the Community
Based Services office door.”
• Osceola County Sheriff’s Office Primary Report 67-
2301447 dated 8/28/23: Report outlines Youth A saying he
took the van keys from the desk when he did not have
6

permission to be in the office and left the facility when Staff
1 was downstairs.
Analysis The facility is in noncompliance as the van keys were left in the
desk drawer located in the staff office, instead of Holbrook as the
facility’s policy outlines. The staff office door was open, and the
staff desk was unlocked allowing Youth A to enter the staff office
and take the van keys from the desk.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2023C0000017 dated 12/02/22; CAP approved 12/13/22
SIR2023C0000019 dated 02/23/23; CAP approved 03/14/23
SIR2023C0000416 dated 05/02/23; CAP approved 06/02/23
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
